# Homework 3

## Library
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggridges)
library(p8105.datasets)
data("instacrt")

```
## Problem 1
### Number of aisle and the most popular one
```{r}
ais_num = 
  max(pull(instacart,aisle_id))
ais_num
instacart %>% 
  group_by(aisle) %>% 
  summarize(
    n_ais = n()
  ) %>% 
  arrange(desc(n_ais)) %>% 
  filter(min_rank(desc(n_ais))<2) %>% 
  pull(aisle)
```

### Plot
```{r}
instacart %>% 
  group_by(aisle) %>% 
  summarize(
    n_ais = n()
  ) %>% 
  filter(n_ais > 10000) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = aisle, y = n_ais)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(
    title = "Aisle orders plot",
    x = "Aisle names",
    y = "Order amount",
    caption = "Data from instacart"
  ) +
  ggthemes::theme_excel()+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90,hjust=1))
```

### 3 most popular in three aisles
```{r}
instacart %>% 
  filter(aisle == c("baking ingredients", "dog food care", "packaged vegetables fruits")) %>% 
  group_by(aisle, product_name) %>% 
  summarize(
    sum = sum(order_number)
  ) %>% 
filter(min_rank(desc(sum))<=3) %>% 
  arrange(desc(sum)) %>% 
 knitr::kable()
```

### Table
```{r}
  instacart %>% 
  filter(product_name == c("Pink Lady Apples", "Coffee Ice Cream")) %>%
  group_by(product_name, order_dow) %>% 
  summarize(
   ohd_mean = mean(order_hour_of_day)
  ) %>% 
    pivot_wider(
    names_from = order_dow,
    values_from = ohd_mean,
  ) %>% 
  mutate(order_dow = recode(order_dow, "0" = "Sun", "1" = "Mon", "2" = "Tue", "3" = "Wed", "4" = "Thu", "5" = "Fri", "6" = "Sat")) %>% 
   knitr::kable()
```
